## Discussion

The frame interpolator converts the horizontal component of each value in [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/motionTexture] into fragment (pixel) coordinates by multiplying it by this property’s value.

# motionVectorScaleX

**Instance Property**

The horizontal scale factor the frame interpolator applies to the input motion texture.

## Declaration

```swift
var motionVectorScaleX: Float { get set }
```

## Discussion

The frame interpolator converts the horizontal component of each value in [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/motionTexture] into fragment (pixel) coordinates by multiplying it by this property’s value.

If you set this property’s value to `1.0`, this interpolator expects that each pixel’s motion vector points to the location where that pixel is in the [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/prevColorTexture]. For example, in Metal’s standard device coordinates where `(0,0)` represents the upper-left corner of the framebuffer, the motion vectors for an object that moves down and to the right in the [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/colorTexture] by `10` pixels would be `(-10,-10)`.
